com.mapbox.mapboxsdk.style.sources

Class GeoJsonSource

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.mapbox.mapboxsdk.style.sources.Source
      • com.mapbox.mapboxsdk.style.sources.GeoJsonSource

  • @UiThread
public class GeoJsonSource
extends Source
    GeoJson source, allows using FeatureCollections from Json.
    See Also:
    the style specification

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods Deprecated Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      protected void finalize() 
      com.mapbox.geojson.FeatureCollection getClusterChildren(com.mapbox.geojson.Feature cluster)
      Returns the children of a cluster (on the next zoom level) given its id (cluster_id value from feature properties).
      int getClusterExpansionZoom(com.mapbox.geojson.Feature cluster)
      Returns the zoom on which the cluster expands into several children (useful for "click to zoom" feature) given the cluster's cluster_id (cluster_id value from feature properties).
      com.mapbox.geojson.FeatureCollection getClusterLeaves(com.mapbox.geojson.Feature cluster, long limit, long offset)
      Returns all the leaves of a cluster (given its cluster_id), with pagination support: limit is the number of leaves to return (set to Infinity for all points), and offset is the amount of points to skip (for pagination).

      Get the URI of the source.

      • GeoJsonSource

        public GeoJsonSource(java.lang.String id,
                     java.net.URI uri)
        Create a GeoJsonSource from a geo json URI

        An URI is a combination of a protocol and a resource path. The following URI protocol schemes are supported:

        • http://
          • load resources using HyperText Transfer Protocol
        • file://
          • load resources from the Android file system
        • asset://
          • load resources from the binary packaged assets folder
        Parameters:
        id - the source id
        uri - unique resource identifier

      • GeoJsonSource

        public GeoJsonSource(java.lang.String id,
                     java.net.URI uri,
                     GeoJsonOptions options)
        Create a GeoJsonSource from a geo json URI and non-default GeoJsonOptions

        An URI is a combination of a protocol and a resource path. The following URI protocol schemes are supported:

        • http://
          • load resources using HyperText Transfer Protocol
        • file://
          • load resources from the Android file system
        • asset://
          • load resources from the binary packaged assets folder
        Parameters:
        id - the source id
        uri - remote json file
        options - options

    • Method Detail

      • setGeoJson

        public void setGeoJson(com.mapbox.geojson.Feature feature)
        Updates the GeoJson with a single feature. The update is performed asynchronously, so the data won't be immediately visible or available to query when this method returns.
        Parameters:
        feature - the GeoJSON Feature to set

      • setGeoJson

        public void setGeoJson(com.mapbox.geojson.Geometry geometry)
        Updates the GeoJson with a single geometry. The update is performed asynchronously, so the data won't be immediately visible or available to query when this method returns.
        Parameters:
        geometry - the GeoJSON Geometry to set

      • setGeoJson

        public void setGeoJson(@Nullable
                       com.mapbox.geojson.FeatureCollection featureCollection)
        Updates the GeoJson. The update is performed asynchronously, so the data won't be immediately visible or available to query when this method returns.
        Parameters:
        featureCollection - the GeoJSON FeatureCollection

      • setGeoJson

        public void setGeoJson(java.lang.String json)
        Updates the GeoJson. The update is performed asynchronously, so the data won't be immediately visible or available to query when this method returns.
        Parameters:
        json - the raw GeoJson FeatureCollection string

      • setUri

        public void setUri(@NonNull
                   java.net.URI uri)
        Updates the URI of the source.

        An URI is a combination of a protocol and a resource path. The following URI protocol schemes are supported:

        • http://
          • load resources using HyperText Transfer Protocol
        • file://
          • load resources from the Android file system
        • asset://
          • load resources from the binary packaged assets folder
        Parameters:
        uri - the GeoJSON FeatureCollection uri

      • setUrl

public void setUrl(java.lang.String url)

        Updates the url
        Parameters:
        url - the GeoJSON FeatureCollection url

        • http://
          • load resources using HyperText Transfer Protocol
        • file://
          • load resources from the Android file system
        • asset://
          • load resources from the binary packaged assets folder

      • querySourceFeatures

        @NonNull
public java.util.List<com.mapbox.geojson.Feature> querySourceFeatures(@Nullable
                                                                               Expression filter)
        Queries the source for features.
        Parameters:
        filter - an optional filter expression to filter the returned Features
        Returns:
        the features

      • getClusterChildren

        @NonNull
public com.mapbox.geojson.FeatureCollection getClusterChildren(@NonNull
                                                                        com.mapbox.geojson.Feature cluster)
        Returns the children of a cluster (on the next zoom level) given its id (cluster_id value from feature properties).

        Requires configuring this source as a cluster by calling GeoJsonOptions.withCluster(boolean).

        Parameters:
        cluster - cluster from which to retrieve children from
        Returns:
        a list of features for the underlying children

      • getClusterLeaves

        @NonNull
public com.mapbox.geojson.FeatureCollection getClusterLeaves(@NonNull
                                                                      com.mapbox.geojson.Feature cluster,
                                                                      long limit,
                                                                      long offset)
        Returns all the leaves of a cluster (given its cluster_id), with pagination support: limit is the number of leaves to return (set to Infinity for all points), and offset is the amount of points to skip (for pagination).

        Requires configuring this source as a cluster by calling GeoJsonOptions.withCluster(boolean).

        Parameters:
        cluster - cluster from which to retrieve leaves from
        limit - limit is the number of points to return
        offset - offset is the amount of points to skip (for pagination)
        Returns:
        a list of features for the underlying leaves

      • getClusterExpansionZoom

        public int getClusterExpansionZoom(@NonNull
                                   com.mapbox.geojson.Feature cluster)
        Returns the zoom on which the cluster expands into several children (useful for "click to zoom" feature) given the cluster's cluster_id (cluster_id value from feature properties).

        Requires configuring this source as a cluster by calling GeoJsonOptions.withCluster(boolean).

        Parameters:
        cluster - cluster from which to retrieve the expansion zoom from
        Returns:
        the zoom on which the cluster expands into several children
